result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makaelon Rodney Bennett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Makaelon Rodney Bennett.  Attorney Annie Louk appeared in court on behalf of Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant has a pending felony matter. Court has no objection to this matter being resolved with the felony matter as part of a global resolution. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Matter will be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state, but need additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Newport.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/16/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 036357,
Payable Number: 999960,
Receipt Number: 22RP015340,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/14/22 @ 1:30p
